@graph.description: Immunofluorescent images of male adolescent rat brain. Rats were exposed to 3,3'-dichloro-biphenyl-4-ol (sham, low, medium, and high groups) in a 28-day polymeric implant study. Four brain regions were analyzed.
@graph.name: Exposure to 3,3'-dichloro-biphenyl-4-ol using a Polymeric Subacute Implant System Affects Striatal Microglia in Male Adolescent Rats

@graph.description: Adolescent rat striatum brain region. - These specimens were exposed via a polymeric implant containing 1% 4-11 by weight. The striatum brain region was analyzed.
@graph.name: Low Exposed Striatum

@graph.description: Adolescent rat striatum brain region. - These specimens were exposed via a polymeric implant containing 10% 4-11 by weight. The striatum brain region was analyzed.
@graph.name: High Exposed Striatum

@graph.description: Adolescent rat cerebellum brain region. - These specimens served as controls for this experiment and were administered a polymeric implant containing 0% 4-11. The cerebellum brain region was analyzed.
@graph.name: Sham Cerebellum

@graph.description: Adolescent rat cerebellum brain region. - These specimens were exposed via a polymeric implant containing 10% 4-11 by weight. The cerebellum brain region was analyzed.
@graph.name: High Exposed Cerebellum

@graph.name: Sham Striatum

@graph.description: Adolescent rat hippocampus brain region. - These specimens were exposed via a polymeric implant containing 10% 4-11 by weight. The hippocampus CA3 brain region was analyzed.
@graph.name: High Exposed Hippocampus

@graph.name: Medium Exposed Striatum

@graph.description: Adolescent rat hippocampus brain region. - These specimens were exposed via a polymeric implant containing 1% 4-11 by weight. The prefrontal cortex brain region was analyzed.
@graph.name: Low Exposed Prefrontal Cortex

@graph.description: Tissue sections, frozen in O.C.T., were taken from the dorsal striatum and the lateral cortex of the cerebellum. These sections were cut using a cryostat (CM3050S, Leica Biosystems, Wetzlar, Germany). The slices were stained with primary antibodies for allograft inflammatory factor 1 (Iba1), a marker for microglia, and glial fibrillary acidic protein (GFAP), a marker for astroglial injury, followed by Alexa 488 and Alexa 647 secondary antibodies. DAPI and PSVue 550 were added and images were acquired using a Leica TCS SP8 confocal microscope (Leica Camera, Wetzlar, Germany). Three images from the dorsal striatum and the lateral cortex of the cerebellum per subject were analyzed and quantified using ImageJ (version 1.53t).
@graph.labEquipment: Leica TCS SP8 confocal microscope (Leica Camera, Wetzlar, Germany)
@graph.name: Image Acquisition
